meanings.definition: A sudden feeling of fear or alarm.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise gave me a gliff.
meanings.sent2: She got a gliff when she saw a spider on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected knock on the door gave her a gliff.
meanings.sent4: The shadowy figure in the dark alley was a gliff to the passerby.
meanings.sent5: The sudden lightning strike outside the window caused a gliff among the children.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel a sudden fear or alarm.
meanings.sent1: Don't sneak up on me and gliff me like that!
meanings.sent2: The horror movie really gliffed her last night.
meanings.sent3: He loves to gliff his little sister by jumping out and scaring her.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected sound of breaking glass gliffed the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent5: The sudden appearance of the ghost in the mirror gliffed everyone in the room.
